sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"提出，提供"之意。
means: offer ： 最普通用词，多指主动提出或提供意见或东西等，但是否接受由对方自行决定。
present ： 既可指提出意见建议等，又可指拿出某物供人欣赏或赠送。
propose ： 指直接而主动地提出问题或建议等，也指在讨论或争辨中提出具体意见或建议。
volunteer与offer同义，侧重出于自愿，而不是寿命做某事。

sentence.Network_en: Slimming snacks that offer miraculous weight loss are a con.
sentence.Network_cn: 有神奇减肥效果的瘦身点心是一个骗局。

sentence.Network_en: Leningrad was the third alien city to offer him a surrogate home.
sentence.Network_cn: 列宁格勒是他在异地安家的第三个外国城市。

sentence.Network_en: Contemporary African cinema has much to offer in its vitality and freshness.
sentence.Network_cn: 当代非洲电影在活力和新颖性上颇足称道。

jx.jx_en_mean: have something available to be used or appreciated
extend one's hand to be shaken as a sign of friendship

lj.lj_ly: the number of permanent jobs on offer is relatively small.
lj.lj_ls: 长期工作的机会相对较小。

jx.jx_en_mean: willing to sell something or do a job for a reasonable price
jx.jx_cn_mean: 愿意以合适价格出售某物；愿意以合适代价做某一工作

jx.jx_en_mean: (technical)put something in place to test or assess its appearance or fit
jx.jx_cn_mean: (技)把…摆好（或放到位）（以便检测或评估其外观或状况）

lj.lj_ly: the infill panels are offered up and bolted in position.
lj.lj_ls: 用于镶拼的填块已摆好位置并用螺栓固定，以便检验外观效果以及是否合适。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English offrian 'sacrifice (something) to a deity', of Germanic origin, from Latin offerre 'bestow, present' (in ecclesiastical Latin 'offer to God'), reinforced by French offrir (which continued to express the primary sense). The noun (late Middle English) is from French offre

encyclopedia.content: offer（报盘），也叫报价，是卖方主动向买方提供商品信息，或者是对询盘（inquire）的答复，是卖方根据买方的来信，向买方报盘，其内容可包括商品名称、规格、数量、包装条件、价格、付款方式和交货期限等。报盘有两种：虚盘（non-firm offers）和实盘（firm offers）。 虚盘（non-firm offers）, 即无约束力的报盘。一般情况下，多数报盘均为虚盘，虚盘不规定报盘的有效日期，并且附有保留条件，如：The offer is subject to our

entry.def: If you offer something to someone, you ask them if they would like to have it or use it.

example.ex: He has offered seats at the conference table to the Russian leader and the president of Kazakhstan...
example.tran: 他已邀请俄罗斯领导人和哈萨克斯坦总统参加会谈。

example.ex: The number of companies offering them work increased...
example.tran: 越来越多的公司向他们提供工作机会。

entry.def: If you offer to do something, you say that you are willing to do it.

example.ex: Peter offered to teach them water-skiing...
example.tran: 彼得主动提出教他们滑水。

example.ex: 'Can I get you a drink,' she offered.
example.tran: “想要喝点什么吗，”她提议道。

entry.def: An offer is something that someone says they will give you or do for you.

example.ex: The offer of talks with Moscow marks a significant change from the previous western position...
example.tran: 提议与莫斯科举行会谈标志着西方立场的重大转变。

example.ex: 'I ought to reconsider her offer to move in,' he mused...
example.tran: “我该重新考虑她让我搬去和她一起住的提议，”他思忖着。

entry.tran: 提供（信息、建议等）；作出（表扬）
entry.def: If you offer someone information, advice, or praise, you give it to them, usually because you feel that they need it or deserve it.

example.ex: They manage a company offering advice on mergers and acquisitions...
example.tran: 他们经营着一家为兼并收购业务提供咨询的公司。

example.ex: She offered him emotional and practical support in countless ways...
example.tran: 她以数不清的方式给予了他情感上和实质上的支持。

entry.def: If you offer someone something such as love or friendship, you show them that you feel that way towards them.

example.ex: The President has offered his sympathy to the Georgian people...
example.tran: 总统对格鲁吉亚人民表示了同情。

example.ex: It must be better to be able to offer them love and security...
example.tran: 要是能给予他们关爱和安全感肯定会更好。

entry.tran: （向上帝或神）奉献（祈祷、赞美），祭献（牺牲）
entry.def: If people offer prayers, praise, or a sacrifice to God or a god, they speak to or give something to their god.

example.ex: Church leaders offered prayers and condemned the bloodshed...
example.tran: 教会领袖向上帝祈祷并谴责流血事件。

example.ex: He will offer the first harvest of rice to the sun goddess.
example.tran: 他将把收获的第一束稻子献给太阳女神。

entry.tran: （机构等）提供，给予（服务、产品等）
entry.def: If an organization offers something such as a service or product, it provides it.

example.ex: We have been successful because we are offering a quality service...
example.tran: 我们因提供的服务水准一流一直经营得很成功。

example.ex: Sainsbury's is offering customers 1p for each shopping bag reused...
example.tran: 塞恩斯伯里超市为重复利用购物袋的顾客提供每只1便士的奖励。

entry.def: An offer in a shop is a specially low price for a specific product or something extra that you get if you buy a certain product.

example.ex: This month's offers include a shirt, trousers and bed covers...
example.tran: 本月的特价商品包括一款衬衫、裤子和多种床罩。

example.ex: Today's special offer gives you a choice of three destinations...
example.tran: 今天推出的特价线路有3个目的地可供选择。

entry.def: If you offer a particular amount of money for something, you say that you will pay that much to buy it.

example.ex: Whitney has offered $21.50 a share in cash for 49.5 million Prime shares...
example.tran: 惠特尼公司开出每股21.50美元的现金价收购4,950 万股普赖姆公司的股票。

example.ex: They are offering farmers $2.15 a bushel for corn...
example.tran: 他们向农民出价每蒲式耳2.15美元收购玉米。

entry.def: An offer is the amount of money that someone says they will pay to buy something or give to someone because they have harmed them in some way.

example.ex: The lawyers say no one else will make me an offer...
example.tran: 律师说不会再有人给我出价了。

example.ex: He has dismissed an offer of compensation.
example.tran: 他拒绝接受赔偿金。

entry.def: If you have something to offer, you have a quality or ability that makes you important, attractive, or useful.

example.ex: In your free time, explore all that this incredible city has to offer.
example.tran: 您可以在闲暇时间探索这座美妙城市的各种风情。

entry.tran: 提供的；供使用的；待售的
entry.def: If there is something on offer, it is available to be used or bought.

example.ex: Savings schemes are the best retail investment products on offer.
example.tran: 储蓄方案是现有的最佳零售投资产品。

example.ex: ...country cottages on offer at bargain prices.
example.tran: 低价出售的乡村别墅

entry.tran: 愿意考虑买方出价；愿意接受合理报价
entry.def: If you are open to offers, you are willing to do something if someone will pay you an amount of money that you think is reasonable.

example.ex: It seems that while the Kiwis are keen to have him, he is still open to offers.
example.tran: 看来尽管新西兰几维队很想与他签约，他仍然欢迎其他球队开价。

sentences.sentence: "a generous offer of assistance"

means.word_mean: 2. something offered (as a proposal or bid);

sentences.sentence: "noteworthy new offerings for investors included several index funds"
"he took a crack at it"
"I gave it a whirl"

means.word_mean: 1. make available or accessible, provide or furnish;

sentences.sentence: "The conference center offers a health spa"
"The hotel offers private meeting rooms"
"She offered us all a cold drink"
"She volunteered to drive the old lady home"
"I offered to help with the dishes but the hostess would not hear of it"
"He offered his opinion"
"extend my greetings"
"He offered his sympathy"
"The stores are offering specials on sweaters this week"
"The Swiss dealer offered $2 million for the painting"

means.word_mean: 8. produce or introduce on the stage;

sentences.sentence: "The Shakespeare Company is offering `King Lear' this month"

means.word_mean: 9. present as an act of worship;

sentences.sentence: "offer prayers to the gods"
"put up a good fight"
"offer resistance"
"extend a loan"
"The bank offers a good deal on new mortgages"
"he popped the question on Sunday night"
"she proposed marriage to the man she had known for only two months"
"The old bachelor finally declared himself to the young woman"
"I offered to leave the committee if they did not accept my proposal"

auth_sentence.content: Don't offer advice unless they ask for it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Don't offer advice unless they ask for it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Don't offer advice unless they ask for it.

auth_sentence.content: The BBC did not offer money for the children.
auth_sentence.res_content: The BBC did not offer money for the children.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The BBC did not offer money for the children.

auth_sentence.content: Those songs aren't the only finery on offer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Those songs aren't the only finery on offer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those songs aren't the only finery on offer.

stems_affixes.word_buile: aqui水+fer带来,拿来+ous……的→带来水的
differ[v.不同]+ent表形容词→adj.不同的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 肥沃的,富饶的;能繁殖的
stems_affixes.word_buile: fert=fer带来,拿来+ile能……的→能带来粮食→肥沃的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有花的,开花的,多花的,花盛开的
stems_affixes.word_buile: flori=flor花+fer带来,拿来+ous……的→带来花→有花的
in不+different不同的→同与不同的"事不关已" →冷漠的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能推理的, 能推论的
stems_affixes.word_buile: infer[v.推论,推断]+able能……的→adj.能推理的, 能推论的
infer[v.推论,推断]+ent+ial……的→adj.推论性的
odori=odor气味+fer带来,拿来+ous……的→带来气味的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可归[起]因于……的, 可归入……的; 与……有关的
stems_affixes.word_buile: refer[v.参考,查询;提到,引用,涉及;提交,上呈]+able能……的→能提到的,能找到原因的→可归于……
suffer[v.受苦]+able能……的→adj.可容忍的,可忍耐的
transfer[n.&v.转移;转换;转让;过户;迁移;改乘]+able能……的→adj.可转让的
aqui水+fer带来,拿来→n.含水土层, 蓄水层
confer[v.商讨;授予,颁给[勋衔,学位等]]+ence表名词→n.[正式]会议;讨论,商谈

stems_affixes.value_cn: 给予, 商量, 授予
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+fer带来,拿来+ment表名词→共同带来东西→给予[奖品等]
coni松果+fer带来,拿来→带来松果的树→针叶树

stems_affixes.value_cn: 针叶树的,松类的,结球果的
stems_affixes.word_buile: conifer[n.针叶树]+ous……的→n.针叶树的,松类的,结球果的
defer敬从+ence表名词→n.敬意,尊重
defer推迟+ment表名词→n.推迟;延迟
differ[v.不同]+ence表名词→n.不同
fer带来,拿来+ry状态,性质→带来带去
fertile[adj.肥沃的,富饶的;能繁殖的]+ity表名词→n.肥沃,丰饶
fertilize[v.使受精;施肥于,使肥沃]+er表名词→n.[fertiliser]肥料
of一再+fer带来,拿来→一再带来→提供
offer[v.提供,提议,出现 n.出价,提议,意图]+ing表名词→n.报盘,提供的货物
prefer[v.[to]更喜欢,宁愿]+ence表名词→n.[for,to]偏爱,喜爱;优惠;优先选择
pro向前+ffer=fer带来,拿来→带到前面去→贡献出来
refer[v.参考,查询;提到,引用,涉及;提交,上呈]+ee人→被双方提及的人→裁判

stems_affixes.value_cn: 提及,涉及;参考,参考书目;证明书[人]
stems_affixes.word_buile: refer[v.参考,查询;提到,引用,涉及;提交,上呈]+ence表名词→n.提及,涉及;参考,参考书目;证明书[人]
refer[v.参考,查询;提到,引用,涉及;提交,上呈]+endum表名词→提出[候选人]→选举

stems_affixes.value_cn: 转移;转换;转让;过户;迁移;改乘

stems_affixes.value_cn: 商讨;授予,颁给[勋衔,学位等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+fer带来,拿来→共同带来观点
de加强+fer带来,拿来→一再带来敬意
dif不同+fer带来→带来不同→不同
different[adj.不同的]+iate做→v.区分,区别;[使]不同
fer带来,拿来+ry状态,性质→带来带去
fertile[adj.肥沃的,富饶的;能繁殖的]+ize表动词→v.使受精;施肥于,使肥沃
in进入+fer带来,拿来→带来[意义]→推断
of一再+fer带来,拿来→一再带来→提供
pre先+fer带来→预先就带来→更喜欢
pro向前+ffer=fer带来,拿来→带到前面去→贡献出来

stems_affixes.value_cn: 参考,查询;提到,引用,涉及;提交,上呈
stems_affixes.word_buile: re向后+fer带来,拿来→向后回过头来[看]已经带来的→参考,查询
suf下面+fer带→带到下面去→受苦

means.word_mean: 主动提供; 主动提出; 出价

sentences.en: The museum offers extensive facilities for study.
sentences.cn: 这个博物馆提供了许多供研究的设备。

sentences.en: She offered to help me to learn English.
He offered himself as a candidate.
sentences.cn: 他自告奋勇要当候选人。

sentences.en: He offered me a glass of wine.
I don't need any help, but it was kind of you to offer.
sentences.cn: 我不需要任何帮助, 但是你愿意提供帮助, 我很感激。

sentences.en: They offered to go where there were difficulties.
sentences.cn: 他们表示愿意到艰苦的地方去。

sentences.en: She travels whenever the opportunity offers.
If he makes you a good offer, don't refuse it.
sentences.cn: 如果他向你提出一个好建议, 你不要拒绝。

sentences.en: I am open to an offer.
Your offer is a bit too high.

jushi.english: I will not offer at that which I cannot do.
jushi.chinese: 我做不到的事绝不尝试。

jushi.english: I will do it as soon as opportunity offers.
jushi.chinese: 时机一到我就要做这件事。

jushi.english: I shall come again when occasion offers.
